       Introduced  by  Sen. KRUEGER -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Investigations and Govern-
         ment Operations

       AN ACT to amend the tax law and the administrative code of the  city  of
         New York, in relation to the federal Gramm-Leach-Bliley act

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Paragraph 1 of subsection (m) of section 1452  of  the  tax
    2  law, as amended by chapter 24 of the laws of 2010, is amended to read as
    3  follows:
    4    (1) Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in this section
    5  other  than  subsection  (n)  of this section, a corporation that was in
    6  existence before January first, two thousand ten and was subject to  tax
    7  under article nine-A of this chapter for its last taxable year beginning
    8  before  January  first,  two  thousand ten, shall continue to be taxable
    9  under such article for all taxable years beginning on or  after  January
   10  first,  two  thousand ten and before January first, two thousand eleven.
   11  The preceding sentence shall not apply to any taxable year during  which
   12  such  corporation  is  a banking corporation described in paragraphs one
   13  through  eight  of  subsection  (a)  of  this  section.  Notwithstanding
   14  anything to the contrary contained in this section other than subsection
   15  (n)  of  this  section, a banking corporation or corporation that was in
   16  existence before January first, two thousand ten and was subject to  tax
   17  under  this  article  for its last taxable year beginning before January
   18  first, two thousand ten, shall continue to be taxable under this article
   19  for all taxable years beginning on or after January first, two  thousand
   20  ten  and before January first, two thousand eleven [or in which] ONLY IF
   21  THE CORPORATION IS A BANKING CORPORATION AS DEFINED IN SUBSECTION (A) OF
   22  THIS SECTION OR the corporation satisfies the requirements for a  corpo-
   23  ration to elect to be taxable under this article. Provided further, that

    1  nothing  in  this  subsection  shall prohibit a corporation that elected
    2  pursuant to subsection (d) of this section to be taxable  under  article
    3  nine-A  of  this  chapter from revoking that election in accordance with
    4  such subsection (d).
    5    For  purposes  of this paragraph, a corporation shall be considered to
    6  be subject to tax under article nine-A of this  chapter  for  a  taxable
    7  year if such corporation was not a taxpayer but was properly included in
    8  a  combined  report filed pursuant to section two hundred eleven of this
    9  chapter for such taxable year and a corporation shall be  considered  to
   10  be  subject  to tax under this article for a taxable year if such corpo-
   11  ration was not a taxpayer but was properly included in a combined return
   12  filed pursuant to subsection (f) or  (g)  of  section  fourteen  hundred
   13  sixty-two  of this article for such taxable year. A corporation that was
   14  in existence before January first, two thousand ten but first becomes  a
   15  taxpayer  in  a  taxable  year  beginning on or after January first, two
   16  thousand ten and before January first, two  thousand  eleven,  shall  be
   17  considered  for  purposes  of this paragraph to have been subject to tax
   18  under article nine-A of this chapter for its last taxable year beginning
   19  before January first, two thousand ten if such  corporation  would  have
   20  been  subject  to tax under such article for such taxable year if it had
   21  been a taxpayer during such taxable year.  A  corporation  that  was  in
   22  existence  before  January  first,  two thousand ten but first becomes a
   23  taxpayer in a taxable year beginning on  or  after  January  first,  two
   24  thousand  ten  and  before  January first, two thousand eleven, shall be
   25  considered for purposes of this paragraph to have been  subject  to  tax
   26  under  this  article  for its last taxable year beginning before January
   27  first, two thousand ten if such corporation would have been  subject  to
   28  tax  under  this article for such taxable year if it had been a taxpayer
   29  during such taxable year.
   30    S 2. Paragraph 1 of subdivision (l) of section 11-640 of the  adminis-
   31  trative  code  of  the city of New York, as amended by chapter 24 of the
   32  laws of 2010, is amended to read as follows:
   33    (1) Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in this section
   34  other than subdivision (m) of this section, a corporation  that  was  in
   35  existence  before January first, two thousand ten and was subject to tax
   36  under subchapter two of this chapter for its last taxable year beginning
   37  before January first, two thousand ten, shall  continue  to  be  taxable
   38  under  such subchapter for all taxable years beginning on or after Janu-
   39  ary first, two thousand ten and before January first, two thousand elev-
   40  en. The preceding sentence shall not apply to any  taxable  year  during
   41  which  such corporation is a banking corporation described in paragraphs
   42  one through eight of subdivision (a) of this section.    Notwithstanding
   43  anything  to  the contrary contained in this section other than subdivi-
   44  sion (m) of this section, a banking corporation or corporation that  was
   45  in  existence  before January first, two thousand ten and was subject to
   46  tax under this subchapter for its last  taxable  year  beginning  before
   47  January first, two thousand ten, shall continue to be taxable under this
   48  subchapter  for  all  taxable years beginning on or after January first,
   49  two thousand ten and before January first, two thousand  eleven  [or  in
   50  which]  ONLY  IF  THE CORPORATION IS A BANKING CORPORATION AS DEFINED IN
   51  SUBDIVISION (A)  OF  THIS  SECTION  OR  the  corporation  satisfies  the
   52  requirements  for  a  corporation  to  elect  to  be  taxable under this
   53  subchapter. Provided further, that nothing  in  this  subdivision  shall
   54  prohibit  a corporation that elected pursuant to subdivision (d) of this
   55  section to be taxable under subchapter two of this chapter from revoking
   56  that election in accordance with subdivision (d) of  this  section.  For

    1  purposes  of  this  paragraph,  a  corporation shall be considered to be
    2  subject to tax under subchapter two of this chapter for a  taxable  year
    3  if  such  corporation  was not a taxpayer but was properly included in a
    4  combined  report filed pursuant to subdivision four of section 11-605 of
    5  this chapter for such taxable year and a corporation shall be considered
    6  to be subject to tax under this subchapter for a taxable  year  if  such
    7  corporation  was  not a taxpayer but was properly included in a combined
    8  report filed pursuant to subdivision (f) or (g)  of  section  11-646  of
    9  this  part  for  such  taxable year. A corporation that was in existence
   10  before January first, two thousand ten but first becomes a taxpayer in a
   11  taxable year beginning on or after January first, two thousand  ten  and
   12  before  January  first,  two  thousand  eleven,  shall be considered for
   13  purposes of this paragraph to have been subject to tax under  subchapter
   14  two  of  this chapter for its last taxable year beginning before January
   15  first, two thousand ten if such corporation would have been  subject  to
   16  tax under such subchapter for such taxable year if it had been a taxpay-
   17  er  during such taxable year. A corporation that was in existence before
   18  January first, two thousand ten but first becomes a taxpayer in a  taxa-
   19  ble  year  beginning  on  or  after  January first, two thousand ten and
   20  before January first, two  thousand  eleven,  shall  be  considered  for
   21  purposes  of  this  paragraph  to  have  been  subject to tax under this
   22  subchapter for its last taxable year beginning before January first, two
   23  thousand ten if such corporation would have been subject  to  tax  under
   24  this  subchapter  for such taxable year if it had been a taxpayer during
   25  such taxable year.
   26    S 3. This act shall take effect immediately.
